name: From Assume to Zoom Quiz | Alphabetical Words | 25 Questions

questions.explanation:
anteroom.

	The prefix "ante-" means "before" as in "antedate" or "antepast" (an appetizer). Another A + oon word is attune.

broom.

	Or balloon, boom, or boon.

croon.

	Or cartoon or coon or consume.

dune.

	Or doom or dragoon or Lord Droon (the villain in The King's Stilts, by Dr. Seuss).

questions.text: To place in a burial chamber?
questions.explanation:
entomb.

	Or exhume (the opposite of entomb)!

fume.

	Or flume.

groom.

	Or gloom or goon.

harpoon.

	Or philosopher David Hume.

impugn.

	Believe it or not, "impugn" shares a Latin root with "pugnacious" and "pungent." Another i + oon word is immune.

jejune.

	Or June.

Khartoum.

	Sudan gained its independence from Britain and Egypt in 1956. For many years the Sudanese have suffered from famine, civil rights abuses and fighting between Muslims and Christians. Another K + oom word is the last name of supermodel Heidi Klum.

loon.

	Or loom or lagoon or Clair de Lune.

questions.text: To set (someone) ashore alone on a desolate island?
questions.explanation:
maroon.

	When it refers to a dark red color, the English word "maroon" comes from the French word "marron" for a Spanish chestnut. Another M + oon word is, of course, moon.

noon.

	High noon was a favorite appointment time for rival gunslingers to meet in the center of town for shootouts.

opportune.

	Or octoroon (an offensive term for a person of one-eighth black ancestry).

plume.

	Or prune, platoon, or nom de plume.

questions.text: A person of one-quarter black ancestry? (This is a somewhat offensive term.)
questions.explanation:
quadroon.

	European colonizers of the Americas, especially the Spanish, originated racist terms such as mulatto, quadroon, and octoroon. A person's civil rights were based upon how much European ancestry he or she had (so that an octoroon, someone of one-eighth black ancestry, had more privileges than a quadroon).

room.

	Or rune.

questions.text: A bar in an Old West town?
questions.explanation:
saloon.

	Or soon or subsume.

Tune.

	Or tomb or Toon Town.

questions.text: If a tree has not been cut down, it is _______?
questions.explanation:
unhewn.

	That word was supplied by a helpful player, memorylane42. Check out her "All My Children" quizzes if you're an AMC fan from way back.

questions.text: What some men say when they see an attractive woman: Va va va _______?
questions.explanation:
voom.

	Or varoom.

womb.

	The word "womb" comes from Middle English from an Old High German word, "wamb," which meant "belly."

questions.text: I'm skipping X, and cheating a bit on Y. This word rhymes with actress Thurman's first name. Clue: ________, Arizona?
questions.explanation:
Yuma.

	Yuma, named after a Native American group, is located in the southwest corner of Arizona, near both California and Mexico. Yuma has a hot, clear desert climate, so a lot of retirees live there. Many flee during the summer, though, because average temperatures are over 100 degrees Fahrenheit.

questions.text: This word is repeated three times in a TV jingle that advertises Mazda automobiles.
questions.explanation:
zoom.

	Thanks for taking the quiz! If you think of other words that end with the oon or oom sounds, please let me know. I will add them in.
